item.title: Run percentage?
item.dc:creator: @mawang mawang
item.description:
@mawang wrote:

@ontopic…if/else if/ else statements have certain rules to follow…in this case the else statement has 3 actions it needs to follow, so, because it isn’t just one action, you have to add brackets to include all actions the else statement will do. example below:

if(…)
one line of code
else if(…)
also one line of code
else {
this is one line
this is the second line of the same statement
}

Read full topic

case 74214:
                        if (c.playerEnergy > 0 && !c.isRunning2) {
                                        c.isRunning2 = true;
                                        c.isRunning = true;
                                        c.updateRequired = true;
                                } else {
                                        c.isRunning2 = false;
                                        c.isRunning = false;
                                        c.updateRequired = true;
                                 }
break;

item.title: Run percentage?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Base: Deltascape, 317 deob
Summary: I changed some interfaces and made running work, but now energy percent doesn’t change
Problem: I can run, but the percentage is always at 0%
Answer: none yet
What I want to be done: Make it so the run percentage changes.
My running code: case 74214: if (c.playerEnergy > 0 && !c.isRunning2) { c.isRunning2 = true; c.isRunning = true; c.updateRequired = true; } else c.isRunning2 = false; c.isRunning = false; c.updateRequired = true; break;
Pictures:

runenergynoupdate.jpg766×461

I am running but the energy is at 0% and never was any higher, but I still can run. I also never run out of energy. (meaning I can always run.)

Read full topic
